class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
Title: 
Sex & Gender in the African Diaspora 
Course Description: Freshman Seminar: Gender and Sexuality in the African Diaspora is an interdisciplinary course exploring critical perspectives on gender, sex, and sexuality in the African Diaspora. The course integrates historical and global perspectives bridging together Diaspora Studies, Black Feminism, and Queer Studies. This class will bring together literature, social science, film, art, and include occasional guest speakers. We will work toward a broad definition of queerness to consider various gendered and sexual identities and practices. This semester we will play close attention to notions of home, family, dominant and alternative notions of sexuality and gender.
course_description: Variable topics in African American Studies.
